env.name: env
env.description: environment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

logs.description:
display recent log output
disable colors with --no-color, HEROKU_LOGS_COLOR=0, or HEROKU_COLOR=0
logs.examples:
$ heroku logs
2012-01-01T12:00:00+00:00 heroku[api]: Config add EXAMPLE by email@example.com
2012-01-01T12:00:01+00:00 heroku[api]: Release v1 created by email@example.com

dyno.name: dyno
dyno.description: only show output from this dyno type (such as "web" or "worker")

source.name: source
source.description: only show output from this source (such as "app" or "heroku")

force-colors.name: force-colors
force-colors.description: force use of colors (even on non-tty output)

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

exit-code.name: exit-code
exit-code.description: passthrough the exit code of the remote command

env.name: env
env.description: environment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)

no-tty.name: no-tty
no-tty.description: force the command to not run in a tty

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

run.description:
run a one-off process inside a heroku dyno
Shows a notification if the dyno takes more than 20 seconds to start.
run.examples:
$ heroku run bash
Running bash on app.... up, run.1
~ $

$ heroku run -s hobby -- myscript.sh -a arg1 -s arg2
Running myscript.sh -a arg1 -s arg2 on app.... up, run.1

exit-code.name: exit-code
exit-code.description: passthrough the exit code of the remote command

env.name: env
env.description: environment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)

no-tty.name: no-tty
no-tty.description: force the command to not run in a tty

no-notify.name: no-notify
no-notify.description: disables notification when dyno is up (alternatively use HEROKU_NOTIFICATIONS=0)

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

run:detached.description: run a detached dyno, where output is sent to your logs
run:detached.examples:
$ heroku run:detached ls
Running ls on app [detached]... up, run.1
Run heroku logs -a app -p run.1 to view the output.

env.name: env
env.description: environment variables to set (use ';' to split multiple vars)

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

run:inside.description: run a one-off process inside an existing heroku dyno
run:inside.examples:
$ heroku run:inside web.1 bash
Running bash on web.1.... up
~ $

exit-code.description: passthrough the exit code of the remote command
